definition: to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: I'll just eat toast on the way to class.
sentences.chinese: 我會在去上課的路上喫吐司麪包。

sentences.english: For example, add peanut butter to your toast.
sentences.chinese: 例如，在吐司中加入花生醬。

sentences.english: The burnt toast bread smelled up the whole room.
sentences.chinese: 吐司麪包烤焦了，整個房間都充滿了焦味。

sentences.english: We breakfasted on toast and coffee.
sentences.chinese: 兩個吐司麪包，一杯咖啡。

sentences.english: Turkey, lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise on white bread.
sentences.chinese: 火雞，生菜，西紅柿，美乃汁，白吐司。

sentences.english: A bit more interesting than toast and jam anyway.
sentences.chinese: 比吐司和果醬要有趣一些。

sentences.english: Ham, lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise on white bread.
sentences.chinese: 火腿，生菜，西紅柿，美乃汁，白吐司。

sentences.english: Two toast bread and a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 兩個吐司麪包，一杯咖啡。

sentences.english: Would you prefer toast or rolls?
sentences.chinese: 您要吐司麪包還是小圓麪包？

sentences.english: A couple of pieces of whole-grain toast with peanut butter will fit the bill.
sentences.chinese: 兩片夾着花生牛油的全麥吐司就符合這一條了。

sentences.english: The french toast was so delicious, I might go there again tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 法國吐司太好吃了，明天我可能會再去。

sentences.english: Toast is cooked with dry heat until it starts to turn brown.
sentences.chinese: 吐司是將麪包乾熱，直道麪包顏色開始呈現棕色爲止。
就完成了一份美味的全麥吐司麪包。

sentences.english: Use 100% whole-wheat bread for toast and sandwiches
sentences.chinese: 用全麥麪包做吐司或者三文治。

sentences.english: We will breakfast on cereal and toast.
sentences.chinese: 我們早餐喫穀物和吐司麪包。

sentences.english: French Toast is famous in Frence.
sentences.chinese: 法國吐司在法國是非常出名的。

definition: muffin (loanword)/also written 瑪芬|玛芬[ma3 fen1]
